title: premisebased
extract: Word forms: plural premises language note: The spelling premiss is also used in British English for meaning [sense 2]. ... The business moved to premises in Brompton Road. 2. countable noun [oft NOUN that] A premise is something that you suppose is true and that you use as a basis for developing an idea.
extract_html: Word forms: plural premises language note: The spelling premiss is also used in British English for meaning [sense 2]. ... The business moved to premises in Brompton Road. 2. countable noun [oft NOUN that] A premise is something that you suppose is true and that you use as a basis for developing an idea.
